arm_group.description: Eyelash resection surgery was performed for entropion with Down's syndrome

brief_summary.textblock:
Surgical outcome of entropion associated with Down's syndrome was evaluated. Grading scale
      of superficial punctate keratopathy and score of wearing glasses to correct refractive
      errors were measured.

clinical_study.brief_title: Eyelash Line Resection for Entropion Associated With Down's Syndrome

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  The patients with entropion with Down's syndrome

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  The patients of Down's syndrome who do not have entropion.

intervention.description: Eyelash resection surgery was performed for entropion with Down's syndrome

clinical_study.official_title: Eyelash Line Resection for Entropion Associated With Down's Syndrome

primary_outcome.description: The degree of superficial punctate keratopathy was assessed by the area and density classification which was scored with the area of superficial punctate keratopathy graded from A0 through A3, and the density graded from D0 through D3.
primary_outcome.measure: Grading scale of superficial punctate keratopathy

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: The score of wearing glasses was graded 2; all day, 1; more than half day, 0; none of the day.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
